definition: to sit astride/to ride (a horse, bike etc)/classifier for saddle horses

sentences.english: Two jockeys were thrown in the second race.
sentences.chinese: 有两个骑师在第二场赛马时摔了下来。

sentences.english: The jockey urged his horse to run faster.
sentences.chinese: 骑师催促他的马让它跑地更快。

sentences.english: She says she's going to be a jockey when she grows up.
sentences.chinese: 她说她长大以后，要当一名骑师。

sentences.english: The jockey ran the horse up and down the track.
sentences.chinese: 骑师骑着马在跑道上来回奔跑。

sentences.english: The woman jockey kissed her horse on the forehead.
sentences.chinese: 那个女骑师吻她的座骑的前额。

sentences.english: Further evidence was today taken from Jockey A Delpech, rider of SPARE A DIME, and from Mr J Size, trainer of the horse.
sentences.chinese: 的骑师杜鹏志及练马师蔡约翰今日均进一步作出证供。

sentences.english: Boxers and jockeys have to weigh in.
sentences.chinese: 拳击运动员和骑师在比赛时必须称体重。

sentences.english: No freelance or apprentice jockey allowance may be claimed.
sentences.chinese: 自由身骑师及见习骑师将不获减磅。

sentences.english: No freelance or apprentice jockey allowance may be claimed.
sentences.chinese: 自由身骑师及见习骑师将不获减磅。

sentences.english: Falsehood is the jockey of misfortune.
I made her a superlative horsewoman who rode sidesaddle to hounds.
sentences.chinese: 她是最高级女骑师骑着赛德萨德尔猎狗。

sentences.english: The champion jockey had an easy ride in the Derby.
sentences.chinese: 得冠军的那位骑师在德比年度大赛上跑得很轻松。

sentences.english: Few jockeys continue race-riding beyond the age of 40.
sentences.chinese: 很少有职业赛马骑师超过40岁仍继续参加赛马的。

sentences.english: Apprentice jockey Willy Kan Wai-yue was killed in a fall at Sha Tin racecourse yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 见习骑师简慧榆于昨日在沙田马场堕马丧生。
这位是得过很多次冠军的骑师。

sentences.english: The rest of the field was left to jockey for the silver and bronze medal positions.
sentences.chinese: 其余的外地左骑师的银牌和铜牌的立场。

definition: the Jockey Club, Hong Kong philanthropic organization (and former gentleman's club)
person in charge of pack animals/chariot driver
